page.title: 04ACTIVITIES ON THE R. TEIFI
page.content: {ANGLING}-The Llandysul Angling Association owns 17 miles of the river TEIFI and rent 9 miles. A season ticket costs Â£45, but Old Age Pensioners and students pay Â£17, and school boys Â£2. A weekly ticket costs Â£20. Fishing is mainly for trout, salmon, and sewin. There are 460 members. The modes of fishing are fly, spinning, and worming. The club hopes to include lake fishing later. {CANOEING}- The canoeing occurs between March and October. Canoeists use this stretch of the Teifi because fast water and rocks provide a good "Slalom" course. The canoeists, who camp on the river bank, are mainly from the Armed Forces and collages. Twice yearly Bristol University holds Slalom races for competitors from all over the country. In summer the river is often too shallow for canoeing.
